text: my name is Molly junk and I'm the
infrastructure governance program
manager technical program manager at
Pinterest and as part of my job I manage
the relationship between AWS and
Pinterest and all the dozens of projects
that we've got going on at any given
time Pinterest has been on the cloud
since day one we really rely on our AWS
account team that helps us be successful
with our evolving technology needs one
of the big challenges that we have
specifically for our compute footprint
is not just on the availability but cost
Effectiveness a project that AWS has
really helped us with is also migrating
to graviton it's a big lift for us
architecturally but we're seeing cost
efficiency improvements on some
workloads so this could be a really big
deal for not just helping us scale at
high availability but also do so in a
cost-effective manner so that Pinterest
can be successful as a business on AWS
one of the values that we have at
Pinterest is put pinners first where
pinners are the roughly 450 million
users that use our product to find
inspiration every day and so everything
that we're doing all of the focus on
availability and you know changing
technology needs this is so that each of
those users can have a really engaging
personal experience to find the
inspiration that they need on our
platform so all of this really comes
back to creating this positive place on
the internet and we wouldn't be able to
do that without AWS
[Music]
